ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, definitely - important to know about internationl issues and the developing world - one of the only classes like it at Yale.

This is a survey class of issues that developing cities face. The topics are interesting, although it is hard to feel like you really know much about any one subject, since things are covered at a pretty surface level.

Cities and Sustainability in the Developing World was a survey of different issues facing urban centers around the world. Examples of class topics are transportation, sanitation, and water. Each week we had a long lecture followed by discussion and presentations.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was primarily a broad overview, which did stimulate my curiosity in a large number of issues.
